column1: I personally like the Samsung UI and launcher more than the Google Now launcher.
-secure folder is an awesome feature. You can secure anything from apps to images. It is like a phone within a phone. No more privacy concerns when you give your phone to someone else.
-do not like the secure-wifi notification popping up every now and then.
PLS-TFT (IPS) display is good and viewing angles are alright. AMOLEDs with their disadvantage of decreasing quality and pixel burns over time were a big NO for me.

3300mAh is good for all day normal usage. Battery is almost directly proportional to screen on time. The top end of the battery i.e. 100 to 70% drains very fast but after that from 70 to 5% you get long battery.
Speakers are good for the phone with stereo like sound. The speaker is on the right side above power button
column2: which has both advantage (sound playing irrespective of whether the phone is placed screen up or screen down) and disadvantage (left hand index finger obstructs the speaker during tilt operations).

Review Title : Worth the money (Not really after 4 months usage)
Powerful processor (Not really. It performs worse that Redmi 3s Prime)
Good RAM (Horrible RAM management. None of the Apps stay in memory. It starts again)
Nice display (Still hold good but AMOLED sold hv been given at this price)
Good battery backup (Depends on your usage completely. Hogs battery while taking photos)
Two independent sim plus card slot (Network reception not the best. At times can't place calls while network is showing full bar)
Speaker on side does not get covered (Holds good)
Good camera both front and back (Low light photography is impossible. Fails to focus)
No or minimum heating during long call or gaming (Holds good)

Charges pretty fast without fast charging. You get about 25-30% in an 15 mins charge. (Holds good but make sure you wait for the LED to turn green for the charging to complete even though it displays charge 100%)
Overall nice built quality (Still holds good)
Assurance of Samsung brand (Well not yet tested)
Missed on ambient light and gyroscope sensor. Expected at this cost. (Totally Unacceptable)
Fingerprint sensor is a bit tricky and may take couple of tries (But works good now)
Processor & GPU good for most games but not for high end games like Nova 3 or CoD or even Asphalt at high graphics mode (Terribly underperforms)
RAM management not the best. Most games don't resume but restarts. (Even Chinese phones don't have this issue now a days)
Screen does not light up upon new notification. Had to install Glimpse software to get it lighted up. Should have been an on/off option. (Surviving with it)

column2: Excel and PowerPoint bundled in 6.0 update. Cannot be uninstalled. (Even Facebook
column3: unbelievable)

column1: Being a new model maybe lacking proper accessories. Curved edges does not suite for a tempered glass. Looks odd. (Managed to get a back cover but tempered glass is still a issue)
Back button is a botheration particularly while charging. You have press it couple of times to make it work
column2: maybe more. It happens at time while not charging also.

column1: My 32GB card was shown corrupted on the phone which was running fine on my Lumia earlier but is working fine on my laptop.
UI is plagued with occasional freezes. At least one restart in a day is a must.
At times it says cannot place call over my Jio sim inspite of full tower. Have to disable and re-enable sim to make calls again.

Edited: Stay away from this one at all costs. You will have much better models at same or lesser price. Don't fall for Samsung. They have reduced price by 2.5k in 4 months which means early adopter are scapegoats. Also entry-level or mid-range customers mean nothing to Samsung. They are only concerned with their premium customers of the Note and similar range. Other just pay up for the sporting the Samsung logo I suppose. (Good phone for business use with casual gaming. All day battery and no or minimum heating is a big plus. But Samsung should not have skimped on the sensors and use a Snapdragon processor or a better GPU at least. If you can live without VR then it is a good option in branded segment.)

M going to write a detailed review of this phone for those who ought to buy it...

1) superb Built quality....it has metallic unibody so its very different from vintage Plastic phones Samsung used to make... it feels very Soothing and Premium in hands.... both the black and gold variants look gorgeous

2) Camera : Both the front and the rear cameras gv excellent images in both outdoor and indoor locations... No other phone can provide such quality camera in this price range and i mean No other phone... the color saturation is amazing... Though it lacks front camera flash people interested in that feature may switch to Samsung on8...

3) Fingerprint Sensor : This is the thing to look out for as people complained abt other budget phones providing Fingerprint sensors so here is Samsung... the sensor is very responsive and as u can expect surpasses its competitors quality wise.... so its d latest addition in d Samsung budget phone range

4) Processor : The processor is great and there is no lag in the performance of the phone.. Gamers cant complain as it plays Asphalt 8 and oothe high end Vfx games smoothly without any lag... The processor is better than Samsung On8... The Exynos Processor prevents the phone from heating even on high performance and heavy gaming..

5) 3 Gb RAM is a ggrea addition to this series and it makes the phone blazing fast and its a breathe of fresh air for those who were bored with the Samsung 2gb stuff in all phones... 32Gb ROM ( Internal Memory ) complements the RAM and gives a change of taste so the 2GB/ 16GB combo is now Past...

6) Full HD screen : though its a TFT screen and not Super Amoled no1 can complain abt it...iis just as gud as IPS pannels offered by other mobiles in this price range and watching movies here is an amazing experience

column2: Volume keys and Speaker all r located in perfect position specially the Sidewise position of the speakers is refreshing and gives the phone a fresh new look... The speaker is loud enough and far better than the J series phones..

column1: 6) The Battery backup is great as well...
7) The presence of LED Notification light is overwhelming as it was absent in many Samsung budget as well as high end phones..
1) The Capacitive keys aren't Backlit.... though dts not a feature people take in2 acct nowadays....
2) SuperAmoled is something dt cud have been given as phones like On8 J7 J5  r having dt as well.... but still the display is very gud and users wont complain

3) The On Nxt lacks Sensors like the gyroscope  so it cant be used for Virtual reality also Ambient light sensor isnt there... so users will miss the VR stuff on this device.... it shud have been there cz evn low range phones have these sensors nowadays
Review: Except the VR users the phone will fascinate all others as its a budget beast and the best phone u can get in this range...
*** also the device is a MAKE IN INDIA product dts y Samsung cud afford to give more features in dis price range as the Import duties and other Taxes wernt applied...
